alert.note: Alert for East Cameron; Southern Jefferson Davis (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 30 at 10:25PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN CAMERON PARISH THROUGH 1115 PM CST... At 1025 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gibbstown, or 11 miles southwest of Lacassine National Wildlife Refuge, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cameron, Grand Chenier, Lacassine National Wildlife Refuge, Hacketts Corner, Lowry, Creole, Sweet Lake, Gibbstown, and Rutherford Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
